text:
Company: Benson, Mendoza and Sparks  
Role: Legal Coordinator

Company Background:  
At Benson, Mendoza and Sparks, we are committed to providing exceptional legal services and fostering a workplace where diversity and inclusion thrive. We pride ourselves on our collaborative environment and dedication to professional growth.

Job Type: Full-Time

Job Description:  
We are seeking a diligent and detail-oriented Legal Coordinator to join our team. The ideal candidate will assist with case management, client communication, and administrative tasks to ensure smooth operation within our legal department.

Responsibilities:  
- Coordinate case management activities and maintain accurate records.
- Serve as a liaison between clients and attorneys.
- Prepare and file legal documents and correspondence.
- Schedule appointments and manage calendars for attorneys.
- Conduct legal research and gather case-related information.

Qualifications and Experience Needed:  
- Bachelor's degree in Legal Studies, Business Administration, or related field.
- Previous experience in a legal setting preferred.
- Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
- Excellent written and verbal communication abilities.
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office and legal research software.

Perks and Benefits:  
- Competitive salary ranging from $40,000 to $55,000 annually, based on experience and skills.
- Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.
- Paid time off and flexible working hours.
- Professional development opportunities and continued education support.
- Inclusive hiring process with reasonable adjustments available for all employees.

How to Apply:  
Submit your resume and cover letter via our online application portal. We welcome the unique contributions of all qualified candidates. Our workplace culture supports diversity and inclusion, ensuring all employees can thrive.

Contact Information:  
[Insert Contact Information Here]

Benson, Mendoza and Sparks is an equal-opportunity employer. We offer reasonable adjustments for all employees and provide an environment where everyone can thrive.
